p: In 2007, Al-Hameed et al. described the case of a female health care worker who developed a sudden-onset diabetes insipidus and spontaneous massive intracranial haemorrhage with intra-ventricular extension and tonsillar herniation. Her platelet count and coagulation profile did not show any abnormalities. As mentioned in the table, the woman was obese. The severity of MERS in obese patients can be explained as dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), a transmembrane protein involved in cell entry of viruses such as MERS-CoV, is overexpressed in obese patients [ 37, 38].
